title: Project-Based Scaffolding for Pre-Service Science Teachers’ Integrated Mathematics and Science Learning Design and TPACK Competency Strengthening Program

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of science education theory and experience with ICT-integrated instruction, basic understanding of secondary mathematics curriculum (functions, geometry, statistics, etc.), and experience using digital tools for formula calculations and graph generation
context.additional_context: A course for current science teachers emphasizing the development of technology-integrated lesson design skills in BYOD environments. Particularly highlights elements such as measurement data analysis, scientific variable control, and mathematical modeling when designing STEM-integrated lessons.

learning_goals: Learners design a science learning plan with over 80% completeness using project-based scaffolding, integrating scientific inquiry processes through data analysis and graph interpretation.

Learners identify at least two components each of TPACK’s Technological (T), Pedagogical (P), and Content Knowledge (C), then develop a 12-session lesson plan reflecting three interaction scenarios (e.g., digital tools for math concepts, equation visualization, probability simulation).

Learners develop one 21st-century math lesson model using digital tools (GeoGebra, Desmos, etc.), create presentation materials scoring ≥12/15 on a peer-evaluation rubric (creativity, tech integration, educational effectiveness), and incorporate core math concepts (function graph modeling, statistical analysis, geometric proofs).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
